node.html: Many projects work with relational databases and PyCharm Professional makes this a first-class part of the workflow by integrating DataGrip, our SQL IDE.

node.html: PyCharm Professional has powerful JavaScript features based on its inclusion of WebStorm, a high-end Web and NodeJS IDE.

frontmatter.subtitle: Support for server and browser JavaScript via WebStorm.

node.html: Working with version control systems (VCS) such as Git, Mercurial, and others is an integral part of development. PyCharm puts a common abstraction atop each system, then puts a visual face on all your VCS activities.

frontmatter.label: vcs
frontmatter.title: Version Control
frontmatter.subtitle: Integrated, visual version control across your project.

node.html: PyCharm Professional has powerful web development features based on its inclusion of WebStorm, a high-end Web and NodeJS IDE.

frontmatter.label: web
frontmatter.title: Web
frontmatter.subtitle: IDE support for HTML, CSS, and other web technologies.

node.html: PyCharm is focused on productive Python development, with many IDE facilities specific to the Python language.
Testing and test-driven development is an important part of professional coding. PyCharm's "Visual Testing" puts a friendly GUI on writing and running Python tests.

frontmatter.label: testing
frontmatter.title: Testing
frontmatter.subtitle: Test driven development with PyCharm's visual testing.

node.html: PyCharm's top feature is its powerful, visual debugger. Useful for finding problems in your code and poking and exploring code execution.

frontmatter.label: debugging
frontmatter.title: Debugging
frontmatter.subtitle: Investigate errors and trace code execution with our visual debugger.

node.html: Editing code is the primary activity in an IDE.

frontmatter.label: editing
frontmatter.title: Editing
frontmatter.subtitle: Learning resources when writing code in PyCharm's editor.

node.html: PyCharm is built atop IntelliJ IDEA, our platform for building IDEs. It thus shares functionality with all our IDE tools.

frontmatter.title: IDE
frontmatter.subtitle: Resources related to IDE functionality independent of language.

node.html: PyCharm is built atop IntelliJ IDEA, our platform for building IDEs. It thus shares functionality with all our IDE tools.

frontmatter.label: navigation
frontmatter.title: Navigation
frontmatter.subtitle: Productive ways to move around in your project.

node.html: The Navigation Bar is a quick alternative to the Project Tool Window. On the left-hand side of the bar, you can navigate through the project and open files for editing.

frontmatter.label: navigationbar
frontmatter.title: Navigation Bar
frontmatter.subtitle: Breadcrumbs-style navigation tool, permanent or on-demand.

node.html: Writing Python code means running Python code and PyCharm brings the IDE experience to this primary activity. Code executes in our visual run tool window, driven by configurations you can edit.

frontmatter.label: running
frontmatter.title: Running
frontmatter.subtitle: Run your code in our configurable, visual run tool.

node.html:
Want to quickly find a choice in a long list? Whether it's a file in the project tool, a symbol in Find Symbol, an action in Search Everywhere, or a choice in File | New, speed search makes it fast and simple...without using the mouse.

Filter by:

  • Typing a letter, causing the list to narrow

  • Typing another letter...if you now match only one choice, it's selected and you can press enter

  • Press space and type the letter of another word in the option

  • Use punctuation such as forward-slash to mean directory separator and period to mean file extension

frontmatter.label: speedsearch
frontmatter.title: Speed Search
frontmatter.subtitle: Quickly find an item in a long list by typing to narrow.
